intro: Solanum patameense, commonly known as the Pataménsis nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Ecuador. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, egg-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Solanum patameense produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It is often found in humid, forested environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological and potential medicinal properties.
